twitch_info.title: Highlight: 225+ Hours of Enhanced Interrogation Techniques

message.body: it's not so nice right now LUL
they booted up their PCs and played wow
helloo
what's up
hi xoryla!
I took a break yesterday to rest my hands
you had to stream yesterday?
consequently I did not get any more practice between last stream and this one
no, no stream yesterday
only the stream you saw the day before
but you know, usually I practice off stream as well
I only stream half of my practice
ooh you mean it
you practice off stream
indeed
today was a hard day for me in terms of gaming
i died to outro in ao stage once again
in the same god damn place
must be frustrating
5th time already
that's the true pain of avoidance
well tbh i still find something enjoyable in this avoidance
even after 67 hours of grinding
that's good, you will clear if you can keep that up
the danger is if you get bored
then clearing becomes very difficult
this avoidance is way more fun when you can do it consistently
although i had to clear it 20 hours ago
i didn't like it during my first clear
with my first outro attempt
@razzor_iw you say it about ds or ao stage?
ds
ao stage i liked from the start
hi razzor, I agree
hello, good luck trooper
yeah you had a strong time grinding it
thank you, I will need it
78 hours
still my longest (cleared) grind
uncleared being last tis?
yeah
111h on that rn
you said you will never beat it, was that something you really believe?
nope
i played it 2 days ago and passed curving twice
i probably have the ability to reach phase 5 soon now
but i dont have the time for that
then I wish you the best of luck, if you persevere you will win eventually
for sure
thanks
yeah good luck with this nightmare
any plans after last tis?
probably not
i've been sitting in gms for 6 hours a day on average for the past 2 months
or so
do you think that mayumushi was good practice for last tis in any way?
nothing could've ever prepared me for last tis
sounds about right LUL
nothing i've ever grinded felt the same
and even if you're good at avoidance you're gonna have to spend a long time on that
it's a big learning curve to learn how to withstand
yeah, the damn thing is 11 minutes long
what razzor said, about ds being more fun when you are consistent at it, is why I want to practice it so much before going for the clear
yeah constantly dying to walk or die attack trying to learn it without practicing is a pain
by the time you cleared it, which attack was giving you the most trouble?
as i said the "walk or die" one
ok, got it
super hard to read it
what about shower?
and considering the pressure you have knowing that you are far
makes it being cancer even more
idk what to say about the shower actually
on my early grind i was dying to it every single time
when i make to this attack
which was a pretty rare thing
ds is definitely not very well balanced even if you're consistent
compared to mayumushi balancing this is very lacking
interesting
there are two attacks you don't like
or maybe it was max
which are they?
on ds?
mayumushi
i've changed my mind since
i don't dislike a single attack anymore
it's all consistent basically
oh ok
i made it to final in 15 minutes on my 4th save
but what about sin kun
no clue
he beat it twice, and then on his 3rd time it took him so long to beat
I guess that may have been unlucky or something
my third save did take me longer but i also died on final a bunch more times on my third save
i feel like all of that can just be attributed to my shambling as opposed to the avoidance itself
so how about DS, what are the points you don't like? two of them that I personally have an issue with are final and the sinewave-like curving before why blue.
i feel the same tbh
casualcrap feels that blue has trouble balancing his bosses because the attack designs themselves are sometimes flawed. do you think there's anything he could do to redeem those attacks?
idk i am personally satisfied of the avoidance
I was asking it of razzor, but looks like he left for now
but that's probably because i have a little experience in avoidances
I am thankful he dropped in though
i know i see he doesn't respond
anyways, eventually we will both be very experienced and then maybe we will be able to answer it for ourselves, right?
definitely
it is hard to find disadvantages of the avoidance design or something
now I think it is funny, that the majority of avoidance players would say that clearing ds makes you an experienced player, I neither of us see it that way
for me so far
lorema2SMOREc haha you died
but* neither of us see it that way, I mean
hi nojah
hello nojah
how's it going guys
another clearer of this game, razzor, came in and wished me good luck earlier, so that was good
he has boosted your luck by at least +2
are these full speed attempts?
one I gather the well-wishes of 7 clearers, I will be able to beat it, or something
(don't want to say anything but he's still online though)
no, this is 0.9x
what's your limited speed record?
well, on both limited and 1.0, I have beating the game starting from about 1:07/1:54
what's your best speed rate for a full clear?
I have not full-cleared the game on any speed
I have not tried
damn
since the beginning is rather easy, I think it is not necessary to include it in practice
additionally, I will play the beginning a lot during real attempts anyways
would be a hard thing to full clear the game on a custom speed because of the fall attack
where blocks become bullets for a while
oh yes, the fall attack is another reason
it's pattern, and I don't want to screw up muscle memory for the 1.0 speed pattern too much
and on low speed I don't have sound, so that attack is very hard to play
I could add in sound, but it would probably sound awful
that right there was close to being my 0.9x pb
but I got a final that was probably impossible
but it's still a good thing you can make it to that point
from jump or die attack
yes, if you can get to final, you can beat the game
certainly this would not have been this easy for me even a month ago
even considering that a month ago you were playing it on a lower speed
that means you became way more consistent in each attack in a month
yes, let me check the speed I was playing on 1 month ago
it appears to be 0.7 mixed with some 0.8
that means youll be playing it on an original speed soon
yes, somewhat soon
not like, this week, or anything
but I will get there
oh, that reminds me, this will be the last stream for about a week
but I will keep practicing the game in the meantime
and I will be back after that
oh so you won't stream for a week?
yes
I hope that's okay
i remembered you were saying it
couple of streams ago
maybe you will have even cleared ao stage when I come back
and also when you come back youll manage to play on an original speed
oh basically you said the opposite
just remembered
yeah, that depends on how comfortable I am on 0.9x speed by then
but yeah, probably a bit longer
maybe 2 or 3 weeks
I want to really build my fundamentals
but i am confident in a fact that youll be playing better next week
with everyday practice
yes, that's the key
no breaks!
feels good
well except for my hands, to avoid carpal tunnel LUL
some people don't seem to get those problems
like redire
with 10 hours of playing a hard game
If I played a ten hour k3 run, my hands would be permanently damaged
but he seems fine
wow what a bad class
this lecture is pretty damn good and NONE of the students are paying any attention
my problem is not even carpal thing
it's just a problem of losing my mind
yeah, imagine how the professor feels @LoremasterNojah
an hour after start of the session
like, this guy is really good in his delivery
none of them care about the subject matter
they just want that grade, that credit
i just can't play the game normally after an hour of a constant grind
nothing can replace a love of learning
and they paid huge sums to attend
we get this shit for free
@xoryla if my hands were stronger, then I would definitely play until I mentally could not take it. but sadly, it's always the hands that give out first
like fishing a gold ingot out of the dumpster
you're saying the right things nojah
yes, we get it for free, we didn't have to get into yale (although we don't have any coursework either)
best of both worlds
There are other lectures on that channel, some of which we may listen to at some point, but I doubt anyone else will be quite as good as Paul Freedman
"YaleCourses" ?
correct
"Comments are turned off" LuL
that's the right decision
there is a 0% chance that the comments would contribute any value
the video is the only thing that matters
but I will say, on Herb Gross' calculus revisited lectures, the comments are actually very wholesome
but how am I going to correct all the things the professor gets wrong? lorema2SMOREc
but that's mit
yes, he's got to keep the hecklers at bay
have you noticed any other errors aside from the issue of the number of successors to the roman empire?
eh... one slight nitpick
he didn't mention the pre-Syrian rebellion where Aisha marched against Ali
The Battle of The Camel etc
I guess he just considers that a part of the Syrian rebellion
like the post-Uthman wars are all considered one conflict
it's also possible it was in the reading that we both know nobody read
yeah
he also says "Cauliph" like cauliflower so he should be fired
so he does
how is it pronounced in arabic?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MTI8y5AYS18 this is me and everyone else if they open comments
yep
like klif
I see
like california
or, caliphornia
wait, then that means he says caliphate correctly, but not caliph
the red wedding?
oh good, no final exam Kappa
no questions no problems
there's not a lot of room for questions, is there?
I don't know if I would have anything to ask him there either
I think that's enough for today
i haven't got to that level yet, where you can play the game and listen to a lecture on a different language both at the same time
and I guess that's all for a week
oh well
i guess
I'm only half listening, don't worry
see ya algo
see you
good luck for this week
thanks
